intro: Hemigramma hollrungii, commonly known as the silver-veined fern, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bipinnate fronds. The plant features a creeping rhizome with arching, finely divided leaves that have a distinctive silvery vein pattern. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
